issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

> [@Alex-302](https://github.com/Alex-302)
> 
> Premium self-promo in the video quality menu: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=--iPDgU8JrE
> 
> ```
> www.youtube.com## .ytp-quality-menu .ytp-menuitem:has( .ytp-premium-label )
> ```
> 
> ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0a1cbb9c-4919-4c73-b651-50229b481e6f)

@no-milestone That's not a typical self-promotion and should not be blocked by AdGuard IMO. It's just telling users that with Premium you're going to get Enhanced bitrate. Besides, it's hidden behind the quality menu.

comment.body:
Sorry for the delayed reply.

-----------------

> Could you please test when this domain is blocked?

I have roughly tested `https://www.pixiv.net/` on Firefox running on a desktop GNU/Linux machine and a real Android device, using two different IP addresses in Japan, and I didn't encounter any cases where the webpage did *not* communicate with lc-event.pixiv.net.

Not sure if this is related, but I noticed that in my Firefox, uBO is the only one that can monitor requests with keepalive enabled in the logger.
The logger in AdGuard browser extension and even devtool utilities like the Network tab or XHR breakpoints overlook them.
Therefore, if you still do not see the requests, you might find them in uBO's logger.

-----------------

Also, `https://www.pixiv.net/novel` is apparently sending similar requests through GTM `https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=GTM-55FG`.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2556b82f-5cb2-48bc-9a83-29bff3359350)

`https://lc-event.pixiv.net/log/pixiv/reco/novel?platform=...`

I think ||lc-event.pixiv.net^ is safe, while ||lc-event.pixiv.net/log/ could be safer.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com "poster" ads poke through filters.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.youtube.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific AdGuard Dutch filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Youtube.com "poster" ads now poke through AdGuard's filters. MacOS, Version 15.5 (24F74) 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1: "Poster" Style Ad
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@no-milestone Still as I said, it's not a typical self-promotion. It's not directly impacting viewing experience. Besides, I think subscribers of YouTube Premium are also presented with this Enhanced bitrate option in the quality menu. So AdGuard wouldn't want to block it for them. 
Personally I use a userscript that always auto selects 1080p for me so I never have to go to the quality menu.

issue.title: amazon.co.uk

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body: ### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. - [x] I am running the latest version - [x] I made sure all content blockers are enabled in Safari settings - [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### Environment ```markdown - OS: 15.5 (24F74) - Safari version: Version 18.5 (20621.2.5.11.8) ``` ### What filters do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Issue Details Steps to reproduce: 1. Go to any site that has a cookie pop-up 2. Cookie pop up is displayed even though all of the filters and blocklists for cookie pop-ups are enabled ### Expected Behavior I would expect to not see the cookie pop ups. ### Actual Behavior Cookie pop-ups are displayed. ### Screenshots ### Additional Information The AdGuard test page reports that annoyance blocking is not enabled/detected - however these settings are turned on. This behaviour has started since I 'erased and reset all settings' on my MacBook and re-installed the AdGuard for Safari extension.

comment.body:
> > which implies this is not a missing rule/filter
> 
> The case with amazon.co.uk was exactly like that. That's why I ask more info.

Lots of people are experiencing this issue now. Lots of posts on Reddit and other forums about this.

issue.title: www.youtube.com "poster" ads poke through filters.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.youtube.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific AdGuard Dutch filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Youtube.com "poster" ads now poke through AdGuard's filters. MacOS, Version 15.5 (24F74) 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1: "Poster" Style Ad
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@no-milestone Still as I said, it's not a typical self-promotion. It's not directly impacting viewing experience. Besides, I think subscribers of YouTube Premium are also presented with this Enhanced bitrate option in the quality menu. So AdGuard wouldn't want to block it for them. 
Personally I use a userscript that always auto selects 1080p for me so I never have to go to the quality menu.

issue.body: ### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. - [x] I am running the latest version - [x] I made sure all content blockers are enabled in Safari settings - [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### Environment ```markdown - OS: 15.5 (24F74) - Safari version: Version 18.5 (20621.2.5.11.8) ``` ### What filters do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Issue Details Steps to reproduce: 1. Go to any site that has a cookie pop-up 2. Cookie pop up is displayed even though all of the filters and blocklists for cookie pop-ups are enabled ### Expected Behavior I would expect to not see the cookie pop ups. ### Actual Behavior Cookie pop-ups are displayed. ### Screenshots ### Additional Information The AdGuard test page reports that annoyance blocking is not enabled/detected - however these settings are turned on. This behaviour has started since I 'erased and reset all settings' on my MacBook and re-installed the AdGuard for Safari extension.

comment.body:
> > which implies this is not a missing rule/filter
> 
> The case with amazon.co.uk was exactly like that. That's why I ask more info.

Lots of people are experiencing this issue now. Lots of posts on Reddit and other forums about this.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce

AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? comment.body:
@no-milestone Still as I said, it's not a typical self-promotion. It's not directly impacting viewing experience. Besides, I think subscribers of YouTube Premium are also presented with this Enhanced bitrate option in the quality menu. So AdGuard wouldn't want to block it for them. 
Personally I use a userscript that always auto selects 1080p for me so I never have to go to the quality menu.

issue.title: amazon.co.uk

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body: ### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. - [x] I am running the latest version - [x] I made sure all content blockers are enabled in Safari settings - [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### Environment ```markdown - OS: 15.5 (24F74) - Safari version: Version 18.5 (20621.2.5.11.8) ``` ### What filters do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Issue Details Steps to reproduce: 1. Go to any site that has a cookie pop-up 2. Cookie pop up is displayed even though all of the filters and blocklists for cookie pop-ups are enabled ### Expected Behavior I would expect to not see the cookie pop ups. ### Actual Behavior Cookie pop-ups are displayed. ### Screenshots ### Additional Information The AdGuard test page reports that annoyance blocking is not enabled/detected - however these settings are turned on. This behaviour has started since I 'erased and reset all settings' on my MacBook and re-installed the AdGuard for Safari extension.

comment.body:
> > which implies this is not a missing rule/filter
> 
> The case with amazon.co.uk was exactly like that. That's why I ask more info.

Lots of people are experiencing this issue now. Lots of posts on Reddit and other forums about this.

issue.title: www.youtube.com "poster" ads poke through filters.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.youtube.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific AdGuard Dutch filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Youtube.com "poster" ads now poke through AdGuard's filters. MacOS, Version 15.5 (24F74) 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1: "Poster" Style Ad
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@no-milestone Still as I said, it's not a typical self-promotion. It's not directly impacting viewing experience. Besides, I think subscribers of YouTube Premium are also presented with this Enhanced bitrate option in the quality menu. So AdGuard wouldn't want to block it for them. 
Personally I use a userscript that always auto selects 1080p for me so I never have to go to the quality menu.

issue.title: amazon.co.uk

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body: ### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. - [x] I am running the latest version - [x] I made sure all content blockers are enabled in Safari settings - [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed ### AdGuard version 1.11.22 ### Environment ```markdown - OS: 15.5 (24F74) - Safari version: Version 18.5 (20621.2.5.11.8) ``` ### What filters do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Issue Details Steps to reproduce: 1. Go to any site that has a cookie pop-up 2. Cookie pop up is displayed even though all of the filters and blocklists for cookie pop-ups are enabled ### Expected Behavior I would expect to not see the cookie pop ups. ### Actual Behavior Cookie pop-ups are displayed. ### Screenshots ### Additional Information The AdGuard test page reports that annoyance blocking is not enabled/detected - however these settings are turned on. This behaviour has started since I 'erased and reset all settings' on my MacBook and re-installed the AdGuard for Safari extension.

comment.body:
> > which implies this is not a missing rule/filter
> 
> The case with amazon.co.uk was exactly like that. That's why I ask more info.

Lots of people are experiencing this issue now. Lots of posts on Reddit and other forums about this.
